intro: Diplostephium cyparissias, commonly known as the false cypress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tufted, grass-like foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its growth habit resembles that of a cypress tree, hence its common name. The species is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
